com.turing123.robotframe.interceptor

Class StateBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turing123.robotframe.interceptor.StateBuilder

  • public class StateBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

    The builder to build Build-in State Machine

    INSTRUCTION:
    Build-in State Machine pre-defined working mode as below:
    NoneMode: the robot no need State Machine, any message/event will be proceeded at any time
    DefaultMode: the robot working on the pre-defined State Machine
    FreezingMode: rarely use. the robot will consume all message/event passing through it and do nothing
    CustomizedMode: the robot will working on pre-defined State Machine with only Interactive state, user MUST add the pre-defined state in StateMachine.
    Note that NOT all pre-defined state is available to be added in, more detailed please check the pre-defined state definition below.

    Build-in State Machine by default defined state as below:
    InteractiveState: the robot is interactive with user
    SleepState: the robot is not interactive unless being waken up by voice, touch and etc.
    ConnectingState: the robot is trying to connect to internet

    USAGE:
    1. If one robot does not want to work under State Machine, passing NoneMode when preparing Frame
         e.g. new StateBuilder(StateBuilder.NoneMode).build();
    2. If one robot wants to use the default build-in State Machine, passing DefaultMode when preparing Frame
         e.g. new StateBuilder(StateBuilder.DefaultMode).build();
    3. If one robot wants to freezing mode then passing FreezingMode when preparing Frame
         e.g. new StateBuilder(StateBuilder.DefaultMode).build();
    4. If one robot wants to customize build-in State Machine, passing the CustomizedMode when preparing Frame and then add the pre-defined state. InteractiveState state is added by default and can not be removed.
         e.g. new StateBuilder(StateBuilder.CustomizedMode)
                    .addCustomizedState(StateBuilder.SleepState)
                    .build(); // now we have both InteractiveState and SleepState
